attributes.action: Change trespassing from a civil offence to a criminal offence.
attributes.background: More and more trespassing and trespassers are exempt from any direct police action. What follows are costly legal proceedings against trespassers to eventually evict and in some cases the trespassers return to start the whole eviction process again.
attributes.additional_details: http://dailym.ai/2h40DL0

attributes.action: Allow Walid Durani to stay permanently in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2012 Walid fled Afghanistan to the UK after his Grandfather was beheaded.  Walid was threatened with the same fate.  Since then he has been educated and completed an apprenticeship here. He was Highly Commended at the Youth Build UK awards that took place in Parliament in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
At the age of 18 the UK Government said he should be sent back to Kabul, Afghanistan. Walid has no family or support in Afghanistan and his life will certainly be danger. Kabul is an extremely dangerous place with the Foreign Office currently advising against all but essential travel & in some areas they advise against all travel.
His story has been covered by the BBC,various radio stations & newspapers.
Please help us support Walid by signing this petition. Follow us on facebook - Support Walid

attributes.action: Make Cyclists have a Bell or some Warning device fitted.
attributes.background: Due to the amount of Cyclists killing or Injuring people on Foot it makes sense to be able to Warn others. A new Bike is required to have a Bell when Purchased but then you can remove it, on the Highways and Public open spaces like Hills and Commons it Must be Law
attributes.additional_details:
A number of Cyclists these days take and do dangerous practices as seen, like going through Red lights or going around them on the Path, Riding on the Footpaths, plus a number more.

Let’s start with the Warning Device.

attributes.action: Drastically improve funding for mental health services
attributes.background: I have personally experienced the impact of the cuts to mental health services when I needed the help the most and I know I am not the only one who has experienced this: child or adult. There needs to be far more funding and support from the Government, but more importantly the Minister of Health.
attributes.additional_details: One in four people will experience or may have already experienced mental health problems. The Government really need to start helping those in need and support those that are in need of help. Increased funding to mental health services will drastically reduce the waiting time children, adolescents and adults have to wait to begin counselling and therapy.

attributes.action: Increase Fines and Points for Using a Mobile Phone while Driving
attributes.background: As it has been Proven today’s Fine and Points are Not Working, the Police have said so, we can Still see Drivers using them each time we go out, seeing this Kills as Proven the Law needs to be much stronger, we have nearly been hit by a lorry being steered by one hand and coming over our side.
attributes.additional_details: These Drivers have not Learned anything by the last increase, White Vans seem to be the Worst offenders, Lives must be Protected on our roads from their actions, it may be a good idea to Increase the Points so that they could loose their Jobs to make them think, it’s No good after the fact where others are Injured or Killed, let’s Stop the Idiots that ignore the Laws.

attributes.action: Cancel the £10bn for Help-to-Buy; give it to councils and allow them to build.
attributes.background: Theresa May has today pledged £10bn (unfunded) for Help-to-Buy. This will increase housing demand, not supply, adding further to the unaffordable property bubble. It ignores the systemic issues in Britain’s housing sector and will likely help those that need it least.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the government to, instead, use this £10bn to build truly affordable homes and address the fundamental issues in Britain’s provision of housing.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: More and More Drivers are using the Footpaths to Park on, this causes a number of issue such as No consideration for the Disabled/Blind and Pushchairs where Children could run into the road, plus Damage being caused to the Footpaths due to them Not being made for Vehicles costing Money to repair.
attributes.additional_details: Very often people on Foot with Pushchairs and Disabled Scooters can Not get through which causes a Safety issue with people having to go out into the road with children in some cases, Footpaths as in the name are for people on Foot and Disabled Scooters, the Councils have to pay good Money in Repairs where they are not re enforced, this come go elsewhere to needed causes, many Drivers are just Lazy these days, London should Not be the Only place that Banned them, Not Equal and Wrong.

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: Convicted terrorists should be jailed in special prisons for whole of life
attributes.background: Terrorists aim to kill. When they have been caught and prosecuted they should never have another opportunity to kill. They spread their ideology in prison increasing risk to public when they and others are released. They must be held in special prisons and kept there until they die.

attributes.action: Change the GCSE English Literature exam from closed book to open book.
attributes.background: Last year, lots of students struggled with GCSE English Literature as it was a closed book exam. Because of this many failed. How can they expect us to remember quotes from 15 poems, plus how to analyse them, plus remembering the whole plot, themes, characters and quotes from another book.
attributes.additional_details: Is it really fair that students have to remember so much, whilst also doing revision for other exams. It is important to know how to do all that is asked in the exams, but when in life will you ever have to remember lots of information about lots of texts, then be expected to recall it perfectly under pressured conditions, on top of loads of other stresses, then write about it for strangers to judge whether or not you are worthy of a good grade or not.

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Stop NHS Surcharge Payment for Visa applications (NI contributions goes to NHS)
attributes.background: The Home Office has made it mandatory for immigrants to pay for NHS Surcharge as part of Visa application while working immigrants in the UK pay National Insurance contribution that fund other state benefits and the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Surcharge cost £200 per year and this means immigrants have to pay an excess of £200 every time they apply to renew their Visa on top of their high visa charge. For someone applying for 5 years visa, this will amount to an extra £1000. National Insurance contribution means that immigrants are already paying contribution towards funding the NHS and should be given the right to access medical treatment and not treated differently from EU and UK citizens with regards to accessing the NHS

attributes.action: Reduce Civil Court Fees to enable access to justice.
attributes.background: The Court Service made £100 million profit. The maximum court fee remains £10,000 to bring a claim and £1,090 to have a trial. Its time for the MOJ to review court fees to ensure we maintain access to justice for all.
attributes.additional_details: You are owed £220,000. You have some modest savings and need to issue court proceedings to recover your debt. You will have to pay a £10,000 court fee plus £1,090 to have a trial. There is no legal aid available anymore. You are prevented from bringing a claim simply due to the ridiculously high court fee.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are the main reason huge tracts of rainforest are destroyed every day, releasing huge amounts of carbon into the atmosphere. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Refined palm oil also contains large amounts of harmful fatty acid esters, known to cause cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil#start

http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/ng-interactive/2014/nov/10/palm-oil-rainforest-cupboard-interactive

http://www.rainforestfoundationuk.org/palmoil

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum wage as a factor of the lowest paid employee's wage.
attributes.background: Wage gaps have got out of hand, meaning top earners are paid a ridiculous amount more then entry level staff. Often on a false pretense that hugh salaries attract the best candidates.  It just attracts the greedy.More people are struggling to make ends meet due to inflation driven by a skewed.
attributes.additional_details: impression of growth The average salary is distorted by excessively high wages while most people barely get by. This has driven up day to day living costs while every day workers buying power has decreased. A cap on how many times the lowest salary a company's top salary is would drive up that bottom salary and make wage distribution fairer, would equalise the housing market and boast the economy much more than 99% of money being in the hands of 1% of people.

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Spend aid budget on NHS before all Non-Humanitarian Aid.
attributes.background: The NHS should benefit from funding of the Foreign Aid budget where expenditure is for Non-Humanitarian Aid. It is time front line staff are given decent a pay increase and nurses bursaries were reintroduced to encourage UK nationals to have a career in this field. More funding for mental health too

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background:
The House of Lords is meant to be a revising chamber for Government legislation. It is currently bursting at the seams with unelected peers who claim expenses and do not vote. 115 peers claimed £1.3m in expenses but scarcely uttered a word or voted.
Replace the House with an elected upper chamber.
attributes.additional_details:
It is time for elections to the House of Lords.
Elect people from different backgrounds and experience to represent the people and truly hold Parliament to account.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for alcoholic drinks to list all ingredients.
attributes.background:
I have a severe life threatening allergy to the artificial colourant E110 (Sunset Yellow) and nuts.

Alcoholic drinks in the UK do NOT have to list their ingredients anywhere, not on the product nor online. 

This is so unsafe for people who have allergies and could lead to preventable deaths

attributes.action: Require schools to teach year five and above about LGBT and how it’s positive.
attributes.background: It is important that children know about gay and transgender people as someone they know could be gay/trans or some might be gay/trans themselves.
attributes.additional_details: I got lots of abuse when I came out as gay because the people I was around did not know much on the subject. I also know many people who experienced this kind of abuse.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Require routine scans for head and neck cancer patients after remission
attributes.background: Head and neck cancer patients are not routinely scanned after remission due to protocol. Even though a certain amount of patients have had metastasis from this source of cancer, which has gone from a highly curable cancer to a terminal diagnosis. Scans every 3-6 months should be a requirement.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 Andrew Davis was diagnosed with SCC of the tonsil. He underwent 30 radiotherapy and 1 chemotherapy. He was then given the all clear in June 2016. After this his life started to get better. In June 2017, Andrew became unwell and was given the news he had Secondary Liver Mets, no evidence of disease in head and neck area but the cells in his liver were from that source that had broken away during treatment. We are petitioning for head and neck patients to be scanned routinely.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from having flashing lights!
attributes.background: They are blinding,distracting and at risk of causing epileptic fits.

attributes.action: All pet abductors, ransomers, and thieves to get mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.background: They are as much of our family as our sons and daughters. Thieves, blackmailers, breeders, course hunters etc are stealing to order knowing the overstretched police have little resources to tackle this type of crime. VOTE NOW!
attributes.additional_details: If you had a pet you'd know what to do.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to define a dangerous dog based on characteristics.
attributes.background: This petition calls on the new government to amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to remove breed specific legislation and define a dog as dangerous based entirely on its behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of dogs each year are seized under breed specific legislation, based on how they look and put away in kennels, away from their owner for months to be assessed as to whether or not they are dangerous.

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children’s development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Move PMQ's to prime time on Tuesdays
attributes.background:
Prime Minister's Questions should be moved from 12pm on Wednesday to Tuesday evenings.

This will increase the amount of people able to watch PMQ's and participate in democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest Tuesdays as the best day as there aren't other popular shows on on a Tuesday, increasing the audience.

attributes.action: Give children a choice of water or squash with school dinners
attributes.background: Not all children like water, I myself as an adult don't like it either. So why should a child as young as 4 be made to go all day without a drink because it's the only drink offered with school meals. My daughter being a 4 year old i think it's unfair.

attributes.action: Introduce a 5p charge on single-use plastic straws.
attributes.background: Over 550 million plastic straws are used every day in the US & UK. Most plastic straws are not recycled. Plastic waste poses an enormous threat to wildlife, is a danger to human health and costs millions to the UK economy. A 5p charge on single-use plastic straws will reduce our plastic waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost every piece of plastic ever produced still exists today. Most single-use plastic straws are discarded, often winding up in landfill, or contributing to the 8 million tons of plastic entering the sea every year.
Following the introduction of the 5p charge on plastic carrier bags in England, usage fell by 85% in just 6 months. We can achieve the same with plastic straws. 
#FinalStraw are campaigning to reduce single-use plastics in the UK. More info: http://bit.ly/2y73U3N

attributes.action: Eliminate financial requirement for UK citizens bringing legal spouses to the UK
attributes.background: Currently EU citizens can settle their non-EU spouses in the UK on proof of a legal marriage. For UK citizens there are additional income or capital requirements. These additional requirements discriminate against UK citizens and can prevent resettlement of their non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules for British citizens to bring non-EU spouses to the UK are forcing some to have to leave the UK or abandon their spouse. The Government should be looking after these citizens above all others. British citizens shouldn't have to face this government imposed dilemma of choosing between their spouse and their country.
 
This petition proposes the elimination of the income and capital hurdles that discriminate against UK citizens settling their legal spouses in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Prevent the media from naming alleged sex offenders, unless they are convicted
attributes.background:
The media publish the names, photos, and other details of alleged sex offenders during their trials.  Their future life is ruined regardless of the outcome while the alleged victim gets lifelong anonymity.

We believe this is unfair and the accused's identity should be protected unless convicted.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ibblaw.co.uk/insights/blog/man-cleared-rape-urges-anonymity-accused (24th March 2017)

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/footballer-ched-evans-cleared-rape-12026611 (14th October 2016)

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4909300/Former-student-accused-rape-female-friend-cleared.html (22nd September 2017)

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4909872/University-Challenge-student-CLEARED-rape.html (a separate case also from 22nd September 2017)

attributes.action: To reopen Weston-Super-Mare's A&E between 10pm and 8am
attributes.background: W-S-M, A&E shut on July 4th 2017 due to the fragility of the emergency services due of the lack of senior doctors. At least 27 people use the emergency services each night; from those, 12 are transported by ambulance. Not having their local A&E at their disposal is endangering their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
One resident of Weston Super Mare stated,"We need our local A&E back. The delays encountered by ambulances having trawl between Taunton and Bristol are endangering lives."It's vital to keep this facility open 24 hours 7 days a week."
Another said..
"Please sign.. we need our local services. Bristol and Taunton are too far away, for the person having to care for them, for the ambulance service having to trawl back and forth and waiting times for ambulance services are endangering lives."

attributes.action: Rid the TV licence fee for all students living away from home
attributes.background: Although often living on money provided by government or guardians, students in the UK are still expected to pay for their television licence. Many students already find it difficult to budget their living costs without this extra outgoing.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph states that, due to a recent change in the law, 'Magistrates will also be permitted to apply their discretion in situations where the defendant had been experiencing "significant financial hardship" at the time due to "exceptional circumstances".'

Students are often in some sort of financial hardship and are refused the luxury of watching television whilst in uni merely because they cannot afford this.

attributes.action: Carbon monoxide detectors in student accommodation and lettings
attributes.background:
My daughter has just moved into a student flat were we found no carbon monoxide detectors, which I thought would be a legal requirement. But after speaking to the letting company they told me that they there's no legal requirement for them.
We all know the consequences of a carbon monoxide leak...
attributes.additional_details:
This is what I received from Save the Student when I put the question to them regarding the law...
They are only legally required for any room containing a solid fuel burning appliance, and not for Gas appliances. However gas boilers can emit carbon monoxide, and the government say "we would expect and encourage reputable landlords to ensure that working carbon monoxide alarms are installed in rooms with gas boilers". So we advise you put strong pressure on the agent to do the right thing.

attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/oriental-eye-worm-infection-dogs-blindness-spread-uk-thelazia-callipaeda-a7955711.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-4901936/UK-pets-owners-risk-blinding-eye-infection.html

attributes.action: Install security checkpoints at every underground transport station in the U.K.
attributes.background: Given the increasing prevalence of terror attacks in major U.K. cities, discuss reforms of national transport security policy. Initially install baggage scanners and metal detectors at underground stations and conduct random searches (not based on profile) of passengers crossing station checkpoints.
attributes.additional_details: Global cities more densely populated than London require passengers to place large items on scanners before proceeding to trains and metros. Metal detectors are also used to detect weapons and explosives. It is currently too easy to bring dangerous articles into confined stations in the U.K. wherein likelihood of injury and fatality from terror incidents increases. Requiring random searches of passengers and staff entering these stations could also mitigate the possibility of unfair profiling.

attributes.action: Ban mobile operators from taking payments for phone purchases you've paid off.
attributes.background: Monthly payments for a new mobile contract will often include the service charges and a cost to cover a new phone. Once your contract term expires, and if you do not contact the operator, you will automatically continue paying the same monthly cost despite having paid off the loan for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is the same as buying a new car on finance and being expected to continue your payments once the loan is paid off. 

The majority of consumers may be aware of the practice and renegotiate their contracts, however, many others do not realise that part of their monthly cost is effectively a loan for the phone. 

Standard industry practice should be to automatically move consumers to SIM only when their contract expires or phone is paid off, whichever occurs first.

attributes.action: Air travellers: punish drunken and/or violent and/or threatening behaviour.
attributes.background: To apply within the confines of an airport, or on board an aircraft (especially where this threatens the safety of the aircraft, crew or passengers).  A mandatory 2-year ban from flying with any airline operating flights from the U.K., 5 years for a second offence, a life ban for any third offence.
attributes.additional_details: People arrested for drunkenness on planes has doubled in the last year.

attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.
